bug.author: jako218
bug.summary: 'before' and 'after' keywords do the same thing when adding custom pipeline components
bug.description:
I'm currently trying to build a custom spacy pipeline, but have run into an issue when trying to order the components. Given two custom components, A and B defined as classes with names A and B respectively, if I add them to the pipeline as follows <denchmark-code>nlp.add_pipe(A(), after='ner') nlp.add_pipe(B(), after='A') </denchmark-code>
and then print the pipe names using print(nlp.pipe_names), the result I get is <denchmark-code>['tagger', 'parser', 'B', 'A', 'ner'] </denchmark-code>
However, if I change things so that B set its before keyword as A like below <denchmark-code>nlp.add_pipe(A(), after='ner') nlp.add_pipe(B(), after='A') </denchmark-code>
then I get the same output from print(nlp.pipe_names), namely <denchmark-code>['tagger', 'parser', 'B', 'A', 'ner'] </denchmark-code>
again. I assume this isn't the intended behaviour? <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: OSX Python Version Used: 3.6.3 spaCy Version Used: 2.0.3

comments.comment: Thanks for the report â€“ I was kinda worried at first, but I noticed you're using spaCy v2.0.3. I'm pretty sure the issue you're experiencing is related to this bug: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/1654>#1654</denchmark-link> It has since been fixed, so you should be able to upgrade to the latest version (v2.0.6, which was just released yesterday).
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
